availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, newspaper. Owner(s): Thomas Marshall Green, from 1860 to 1887. Editor(s): Lewis Collins, from November 1820 to November 1847; Richard Henry Collins, from c1845 to 1850; Thomas B. Stevenson, from 1850 to 1853; Thomas A. Curran, from 1857 to 1860; and Thomas Marshall Green, from 1860 to 1887.

ab.bibl:
Kentucky Advocate, June 17, 1887.
Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1874), 28, 185, 200.
The Biographical Encyclopedia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century, vol. 1 (Cincinnati: J. M. Armstrong & Company, 1878), 522-525.
Ron D. Bryant, "Lewis Collins" in The Kentucky Encyclopedia, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 214.
Ron D. Bryant, "Richard Collins" in The Kentucky Encyclopedia, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 215.
